page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This is a predominantly rural area,sparsely populated,the land utilised mainly for crop growing.The principal crop is barley(for the whisky industry),with some peas,wheat,and hay.There are a few small(deciduous)woodland areas.The block is crossed by the M9 motorway,a double-track railway line linking the Forth Bridge with the main Glasgow- Edinburgh line,and the largly-defunct Union Canal. The housing is,typically,stone harled cottages,with the exceptions of a new estate at Echline,some pre-war council housing in Newton,and some terraced housing on Winchburgh's Main Street. Amenities are scarce,as are sources of employment.The principal feature of the area is Duntarvie Castle,a ruin.
